etymologies: late 16th century: from Spanish caimán, Portuguese caimão, from Carib acayuman

definitions: a semiaquatic reptile similar to the alligator but with a heavily armored belly, native to tropical America.

notes.text: Caiman and other genera, family Alligatoridae: three species, in particular the spectacled caiman (C. sclerops)

shortDefinitions: semiaquatic reptile similar to alligator but with heavily armoured belly, native to tropical America
